title: White Screen  League PC PLS HELP
body: So It's just another normal day, get on league, get into a game, but when in the loading screen when i load up to 100% and the game is about to start, my screen goes black for a few seconds then turns white, I can hear the noises but then I can't do anything like alt - tab, click on anything (not that i can see anything) or do anything, so i force shut down my pc and re open it. I try to reconnect to the game and i do and everything is good. But my second game the same thing happens except this time IT KEEPS HAPPENING, i load to 100% then it goes black then white screens, I have checked my computer for a virus but nothing seems to work, someone help me pls thanks.

replies.body:
* Disable any overlays you have (Disc/Overwolf overlays, any of the various info overlays etc. etc., basically anything interacting with the client).
* Update your graphics card drivers.

If those fail you:

* Run a client repair through settings.
* Run the Hextech Repair Tool: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367-Automated-Troubleshooting-Hextech-Repair-Tool

And if all else fails:

* Submit a ticket to player support: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new

I disabled my discord and nvidia experience overlays, my graphics drivers are updated, I did a client repair through settings and now im running the hextech repair tool, I got into a practise tool game and when I heard the sound that i got into the game, I clicked on the tab but the game still went instantly black and then white screened. so rip, hopefully the hextech repair tool will work

Hmmm, you can also try any of the other fixes in this article: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974-Bug-Splat-and-Game-Crashes

But support is probably the way to go, hopefully they can give you specifics.
oh no, its not just league, its happening with Overwatch as well

Hmmmmmmmmm. Do you have a pc or a laptop? If you have a pc and know what you're doing I honestly want to say reseat your GPU, but I'd definitely recommend talking to Player Support. They are much more well versed in this stuff than I am, and if you don't know what you're doing you can damage components.

It seems very likely to me that there is some bad interaction with your GPU somewhere. There's a vague possibility it's antivirus related, so you could try turning that off, or it could be your computer trying to run games with the on board graphics unit (on the motherboard) and not the dedicated (if you have one, some laptops don't).

There is unfortunately a very wide array of things that could cause this, but the techies at player support can probably still help. Wouldn't hurt to contact Overwatch support either for the same reason, one agent might think of something the other has missed.
